statements: SELECT * FROM StudentFeedback;
SELECT student_id, feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT instructor_id, feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE student_id = 123;
SELECT student_id, instructor_id, rating FROM StudentFeedback ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM StudentFeedback WHERE student_id = 456;
SELECT student_id, instructor_id, feedback, rating FROM StudentFeedback WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM StudentFeedback WHERE instructor_id = 101 ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT student_id, instructor_id, feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE feedback LIKE '%improvement%' ORDER BY student_id ASC;
SELECT student_id, instructor_id, COUNT(student_id) AS feedback_count FROM StudentFeedback GROUP BY student_id HAVING feedback_count > 2;
SELECT AVG(rating) AS avg_rating, COUNT(*) AS total_feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE instructor_id = 201;
SELECT * FROM feedback;
SELECT feedback_text FROM feedback WHERE rating > 3;
SELECT instructor_name, department FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT feedback_id, student_id, instructor_id FROM feedback ORDER BY feedback_id DESC;
SELECT feedback_text, rating FROM feedback WHERE instructor_id = '223e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT * FROM feedback WHERE rating > 3 ORDER BY feedback_id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT feedback_id, feedback_text, rating FROM feedback JOIN instructors ON feedback.instructor_id = instructors.instructor_id WHERE instructors.department = 'Math' ORDER BY rating DESC;
SELECT feedback_id, feedback_text, instructor_name FROM feedback LEFT JOIN instructors ON feedback.instructor_id = instructors.instructor_id WHERE instructor_name LIKE 'S%' AND rating < 3;
SELECT feedback_id, instructor_name, department FROM feedback RIGHT JOIN instructors ON feedback.instructor_id = instructors.instructor_id ORDER BY department ASC, instructor_name;
SELECT AVG(rating) AS avg_rating, department FROM feedback JOIN instructors ON feedback.instructor_id = instructors.instructor_id GROUP BY department HAVING avg_rating > 4;
SELECT * FROM StudentFeedback;
SELECT feedback FROM InstructorFeedback WHERE instructor_id = 1;
SELECT course_id, course_name FROM Course ORDER BY course_name DESC;
SELECT student_id, feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE student_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM InstructorFeedback WHERE instructor_id IN (2, 4);
SELECT * FROM StudentFeedback WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT feedback FROM StudentFeedback WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM InstructorFeedback JOIN Course ON InstructorFeedback.instructor_id = Course.course_id;
SELECT course_name, feedback FROM Course JOIN StudentFeedback ON Course.course_id = StudentFeedback.student_id;
SELECT feedback FROM InstructorFeedback WHERE instructor_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM student_feedback;
SELECT student_id, instructor_id, feedback FROM student_feedback;
SELECT name, department, email FROM instructors;
SELECT * FROM courses WHERE credits > 3;
SELECT course_name, credits FROM courses WHERE instructor_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM student_feedback WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT s.student_id, s.feedback, c.course_name FROM student_feedback s INNER JOIN enrollments e ON s.student_id = e.student_id INNER JOIN courses c ON e.course_id = c.course_id;
SELECT i.name, e.enrollment_date FROM instructors i INNER JOIN courses c ON i.instructor_id = c.instructor_id INNER JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id;
SELECT c.course_name, e.enrollment_date FROM courses c INNER JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE e.enrollment_date > '2022-01-01';

SELECT i.name, c.course_name, e.enrollment_date FROM instructors i INNER JOIN courses c ON i.instructor_id = c.instructor_id INNER JOIN enrollments e ON c.course_id = e.course_id WHERE i.department = 'Computer Science';
SELECT * FROM student_feedback;
SELECT instructor_id, name, department FROM instructors;
SELECT course_name, instructor_id FROM courses ORDER BY course_name ASC;
SELECT student_id, COUNT(course_id) AS total_courses FROM attendance GROUP BY student_id;
SELECT course_id, AVG(rating) AS average_rating FROM ratings GROUP BY course_id HAVING AVG(rating) > 3;
SELECT * FROM student_feedback WHERE instructor_id = 1;
SELECT name, department FROM instructors WHERE instructor_id = 2;
SELECT course_name, instructor_id FROM courses WHERE course_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT student_id, COUNT(*) FROM attendance GROUP BY student_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 5;
SELECT course_name, AVG(rating) FROM courses c JOIN ratings r ON c.course_id = r.course_id GROUP BY course_name;
